required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Registry of Subjects With Drug Resistant Epilepsy and Treated With the VNS Therapy System.
clinical_study.official_title: CORE-VNS: Comprehensive Outcomes Registry in Subjects With Epilepsy Treated With Vagus Nerve Stimulation Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: Multicenter global post-market registry of subjects diagnosed with drug resistant epilepsy and treated with the VNS Therapy System.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this registry is to evaluate clinical outcome and safety data in subjects with drug resistant epilepsy treated with the VNS Therapy System. The study will collect outcomes for subjects treated with VNS Therapy in a real-world setting.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months after implant; long term follow-up data through 60 months may be collected, if applicable
primary_outcome.description: The average seizure frequency per month over the last 3 months (by type) will be collected

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months after implant; long term follow-up data through 60 months may be collected, if applicable
primary_outcome.description: The maximum seizure free period over the last 3 months will be collected

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months after implant; long term follow-up data through 60 months may be collected, if applicable
primary_outcome.description: Seizure severity is a categorical outcome and will be rated by the subject using the following categories: Very mild, Mild, Moderate, Severe, Very Severe

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months after implant; long term follow-up data through 60 months may be collected, if applicable
primary_outcome.description: Seizure severity is a categorical outcome and will be rated by the subject using the following categories: Very mild, Mild, Moderate, Severe, Very Severe

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months after implant; long term follow-up data through 60 months may be collected, if applicable
primary_outcome.description: Quality of life is a categorical outcome and will be rated by the subject using the following categories: Very good: could hardly be better, Pretty good, Good and bad parts about equal, Pretty bad, Very bad: could hardly be worse

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months after implant; long term follow-up data through 60 months may be collected, if applicable
primary_outcome.description: Quality of sleep will be reported using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index for subjects 18 years and older and using the Children's Sleep Habit Questionnaire for subjects 2-17 years old; quality of sleep will not be assessed in children under 2 years old

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months after implant; long term follow-up data through 60 months may be collected, if applicable
primary_outcome.description: The name and dose of anti-epileptic drugs used will be collected on a case report form

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months after implant; long term follow-up data through 60 months may be collected, if applicable
primary_outcome.description: The number of times a rescue drug was used will be collected

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months after implant; long term follow-up data through 60 months may be collected, if applicable
primary_outcome.description: The number of times a patient had a seizure related emergency department (ED) visit will be collected

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6, 12, 24, and 36 months after implant; long term follow-up data through 60 months may be collected, if applicable
primary_outcome.description: The number of times a patient had a seizure related inpatient hospitalization and the length of each stay will be collected

arm_group.description: Any approved VNS Therapy System (according to local regulations) may be used in this registry.

intervention.description: The VNS Therapy System is a commercially available device that will be used by licensed medical practitioners trained in the use of VNS Therapy, per the practitioners' medical judgement.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects diagnosed with drug resistant epilepsy and treated with the VNS Therapy System. Eligible subjects include those receiving VNS Therapy for the first time, as well as those that are being re-implanted with VNS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of drug resistant epilepsy treated with VNS Therapy. Eligible subjects include those not previously treated with VNS Therapy as well as subjects receiving replacement generators.
- Able and willing to comply with the frequency of study visits.
- Subject, or legal guardian, understands study procedures and voluntarily signs an informed consent in accordance with institutional policies. In the event that the subject is under the age of 18, the subject may also be required (per EC/IRB) to sign an assent affirming their agreement to participate.
Exclusion Criteria:
• There are no exclusion criteria in this study. Investigators should refer to the local instructions for use for VNS Therapy.
